etymology.description: 海(海) (hǎi, "sea") refers to a body of saline water, often part of the ocean. 洋(洋) (yáng, "ocean; vast") signifies something expansive and broad, usually referencing the larger bodies of water that cover much of the Earth's surface. Together, 海洋(海洋) (hǎiyáng, "ocean; seas") denotes the vast, interconnected bodies of saltwater that cover the majority of the Earth's surface.
etymology.interpretation: 海(海) (hǎi, "sea") combined with 洋(洋) (yáng, "ocean; vast") creates a term that emphasizes the vastness and interconnectivity of the seas, covering the Earth's surface.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢海洋(我喜歡海洋)。
科学家研究海洋(科學家研究海洋)，探索未知(探索未知)。
examples.english: Scientists study the ocean and explore the unknown.

examples.chinese: 深邃的海洋孕育生命(深邃的海洋孕育生命)。
